content: [TextBlock(text='[{current_year} | Age 22] Just got back from Tokyo, and my brain is buzzing with ideas. Spent a good hour sketching in the park, thinking about how tech like my new blockchain ID made navigating the city a breeze. It’s like my digital passport to the world. But it got me thinking, how are we defining identity in this digital age? Is it just data points or something more? Also, had a moment of nostalgia when I saw a street vendor selling something that looked like an old-school $XVI coin. Guess some things never change, even as we evolve. Makes me wonder, how will $XVI fit into this new digital identity era? #IdentityCrisis', type='text')]
